data.text: @Chicken_Wing88 @schooladvocate8 @steveforschools That's what I was thinking! They don't care about academics, just indoctrination. And they don't want any kid out of their reach.

@schooladvocate8 @hsquared216 @steveforschools “The test is taken, but they could fail the test and still graduate?" asked state Rep. Erin Pare. ….And that’s different from public schools in what way?
@steveforschools I’d love to see the numbers of those students who returned back this year 😂😂😂lots from what I am seeing.
@steveforschools @lonedirewuf @hsquared216 I am sure that those numbers will only be higher when the data is reported publicly in July

@lonedirewuf @hsquared216 Projections are they they won’t recover to original enrollment levels until 2030. 

This is close to $4B in bonds since 2013.
@hsquared216 @steveforschools and now they're wanting to put a two and a half billion dollar bond for the taxpayers to foot additional school building??

@steveforschools Sorry, caught me at a bad time. I just read this. I cannot believe this is where we are at. I know you and others are trying, but the leadership is thwarting them. https://t.co/NupLvYsxlA

@steveforschools We need to address a lot more than just learning loss. That certain books are in school libraries is crazy. And that they are even up for debate is even crazier. Even crazier is that elected officials are running away from the issue.

@steveforschools Good luck. WCPSS talked about enrollment numbers constantly before the pandemic. They know exactly why people are leaving. They don't care. The agenda they are pushing has billions of dollars behind it. And 60% of the county will continue to vote for the current board members.
